title: Spack-built `lmod` does not work
body:
I installed `lmod` via Spack, and then sources the respective `init` script:

```
lmoddir=$(spack location -i lmod)
source "$lmoddir/lmod/lmod/init/bash"
module avail -l 2>&1
```

This fails (I used `set -x` to have the shell echo the commands it executes):

```
+ module avail -l
++ /xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/opt/spack/linux-Ubuntu14-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0-spacktest/lmod-6.4.1-p54jyekxznkcagelwdxspnabqwee6dup/lmod/lmod/libexec/lmod bash avail -l
/xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/opt/spack/linux-Ubuntu14-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0-spacktest/lmod-6.4.1-p54jyekxznkcagelwdxspnabqwee6dup/lmod/lmod/init/bash: /xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/opt/spack/linux-Ubuntu14-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0-spacktest/lmod-6.4.1-p54jyekxznkcagelwdxspnabqwee6dup/lmod/lmod/libexec/lmod: /xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/opt/spack/linux-Ubuntu14-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0-sp: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
+ eval
+ '[' 0 = 0 ']'
++ : -s sh
+ eval
```

This looks as if a path name gets truncated somewhere.
